Posts.Content: I am a breast cancer survivor almost 2 years.  Was on arimidex and then changed to femarra because of bone and joint pain.  Oncologist changed to me tamoxifen in July and bone pain has gone.  Hooray.  Only side effect is lots of hot flashes.  Good luck in your therapy.  Jay
Posts.Title: Aromitase Inhibitors

Posts.Content: I spent about a year and half on arimidex and then femarra, and had terrible bone/joint pain.  Now on tamoxifen and no bone or joint pain.  Just lots of hot flashes, but they are easier to deal with than the pain from other meds.
Posts.Title: Side effects of Armidex

Posts.Content: I, too, am on tamoxifen and have the sweats.  When working outside I wear a headband to keep the drips out of my eyes.  I take effexor in the a.m. and think it helps.
Posts.Title: SEVERE HOT FLASHES due to tamoxifin

Posts.Content: After lumpectomy (October 2005), chemo, radiation I went on Arimidex.  Had terrible joint and bone pain.  Changed to Femarra, same thing.  Now I have gone on tamoxifen.  Will the bone and joint pain go away?  Hoping for some answers.  Thanks, Jay
Posts.Title: changing meds

Posts.Content: Just completed chemo and radiation. On arimidex. What is causing strange heat related skin reaction? Feel like a thousand tiny sand flies all biting at once..over entire body, not just exposed skin. Also skin sensitive to weeding, fire ant poison. Is that from the treatments or from Arimidex?
Posts.Title: Side Effects

Posts.Content: Carolgolf, Thanks for responding. Good to hear from someone who has had same problems. I talked to pharmacist and he said that the hot prickly skin was a side effect of arimidex and was capalliaries responding to lack of hormones. I have already been on fosamax, glucosamine chondroitin & calcium. He also suggested to try SAMe and see if it lessens the joint pain. Why did you change from arimidex to aromasin? Thanks again, Jay
